alert.note: Alert for Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 8:26PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A quick burst of snow showers and blowing snow will continue to move across Interstate 80 and other highways... An area of snow showers moving to the southeast will continue to affect the Battle Mountain area east to Emigrant Summit and Elko as well as portions of State Route 306 from Battle Mountain south and and State Route 278 from Carlin southward for next 30 minutes to one hour. Visibilities of one-half to one mile will be possible along with wind gusts to 20 to 30 mph. This area of showers can drop a quick half inch to inch of snow along northern Lander/Eureka and western Elko counties. Travelers driving across I-80 or SR278 and 306 are urged to use caution, reduce speed, and use low beams. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.

area.areaDesc: Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County
